title: Bifunctional Pt–Ir nanoparticle catalysts for oxygen reduction and evolution reactions: investigating the influence of surface composition on the catalytic properties
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,797-810
DOI: 10.1039/D3SE01238G, Paper
Lucinda Blanco-Redondo, Yevheniia Lobko, Kateřina Veltruská, Jaroslava Nováková, Michal Mazur, Alina Madalina Darabut, Tomáš Hrbek, Milan Dopita, Jakub Hraníček, Yurii Yakovlev, Iva Matolínová, Vladimír Matolín
Unitized regenerative fuel cells demand efficient bifunctional catalysts for oxygen reduction and evolution reactions. Here, we study iridium-decorated platinum nanoparticles. Ir40/Pt60 displayed the highest OER mass activity, surpassing Ir black, whereas Ir20/Pt80 showed the highest efficiency.
